name: WOQLClient
description: Client for accessing the Terminus DB API

params.description: the terminusdb server url
params.name: serverUrl

params.description: an object with the connection parameters
params.name: params

name: copy
description:
creates a copy of the client with identical internal state and context
useful if we want to change context for a particular API call without changing
the current client context

returns.description: new client object with identical state to original but which can be manipulated independently

name: server
description:
Gets the current connected server url
it can only be set creating a new WOQLCLient instance

name: api
description: Retrieve the URL of the server’s API base that we are currently connected to

returns.description: the URL of the TerminusDB server api endpoint we are connected to (typically server() + “api/”)

name: organization
description: Gets/Sets the client’s internal organization context value

params.description: the organization id to set the context to
params.name: orgId

name: user
description:
Gets the current user object as returned by the connect capabilities response
user has fields: [id, name, notes, author]

name: uid
description: Retrieve the id of the user that is logged in with the client

returns.description: the id of the current user (always ‘admin’ for desktop client)
the user organization name

name: databases
description: Retrieves a list of databases (id, organization, label, comment) that the current user has access to on the server. Note that this requires the client to call connect() first.

params.description: a list of databases the user has access to on the server, each having:
params.name: dbList

returns.description: the user databases list

name: databaseInfo
description: Gets the database's details

params.description: the datbase id
params.name: dbId

params.description: the database organization
params.name: orgId

returns.description: the database description object //getDatabaseInfo

name: db
description: Sets / Gets the current database

params.description: the database id to set the context to
params.name: dbId

returns.description: - the current database or false

name: setSystemDb
description: Sets the internal client context to allow it to talk to the server’s internal system database

name: repo
description: Gets / Sets the client’s internal repository context value (defaults to ‘local’)

params.description: default value is local
params.name: repoId

returns.description: the current repository id within the client context

name: checkout
description: Gets/Sets the client’s internal branch context value (defaults to ‘main’)

params.description: the branch id to set the context to
params.name: branchId

returns.description: the current branch id within the client context

name: ref
description:
Sets / gets the current ref pointer (pointer to a commit within a branch)
Reference ID or Commit ID are unique hashes that are created whenever a new commit is recorded

params.description: the reference ID or commit ID
params.name: refId

returns.description: the current commit id within the client context

name: localAuth
description: Sets/Gets set the database basic connection credential

name: remoteAuth
description: Sets/Gets the jwt token for authentication

name: author
description: Gets/Sets the string that will be written into the commit log for the current user

params.description: the id to write into commit logs as the author string (normally an email address)
params.name: aName

returns.description: the current author id in use for the current user

name: set

params.description: a object with connection params
params.name: params

examples:
sets several of the internal state values in a single call (similar to connect, but only sets internal client state, does not communicate with server)
client.set({key: "mypass", branch: "dev", repo: "origin"})

name: resource
description:
Generates a resource string for the required context
of the current context for "commits" "meta" "branch" and "ref" special resources

params.description: the type of resource string that is required - one of “db”, “meta”, “repo”, “commits”, “branch”, “ref”
params.name: resourceType

params.description: can be used to specify a specific branch / ref - if not supplied the current context will be used
params.name: resourceId

returns.description: a resource string for the desired context

name: connect
description:
Connect to a Terminus server at the given URI with an API key
Stores the system:ServerCapability document returned
in the connection register which stores, the url, key, capabilities,
and database meta-data for the connected server
this.connectionConfig.server will be used if present,
or the promise will be rejected.

params.description: TerminusDB Server connection parameters
params.name: params

returns.description: - the connection capabilities response object or an error object

name: createDatabase
description: Creates a new database in TerminusDB server

params.description: The id of the new database to be created
params.name: dbId

params.description: object containing details about the database to be created:
params.name: dbDetails

params.description: optional organization id - if absent default local organization id is used
params.name: orgId

name: deleteDatabase
description: Deletes a database from a TerminusDB server

params.description: The id of the database to be deleted
params.name: dbId

params.description: the id of the organization to which the database belongs (in desktop use, this will always be “admin”)
params.name: orgId

returns.description: - A promise that returns the call response object, or an Error if rejected.

name: createGraph
description: Creates a new named graph within a TerminusDB database

params.description: type of graph
params.name: graphType

params.description: id of the graph to be created
params.name: graphId

params.description: a message describing the reason for the change that will be written into the commit log
params.name: commitMsg

returns.description: A promise that returns the call response object, or an Error if rejected.

name: deleteGraph
description: Deletes a graph from a TerminusDB database

params.description: type of graph
params.name: graphType

params.description: local id of graph
params.name: graphId

params.description: a message describing the reason for the change that will be written into the commit log
params.name: commitMsg

returns.description: A promise that returns the call response object, or an Error if rejected.

name: getTriples
description: Retrieve the contents of a graph within a TerminusDB as triples, encoded in the turtle (ttl) format

params.description: type of graph to get triples from, either “instance”, “schema” or “inference”
params.name: graphType

params.description: TerminusDB Graph name
params.name: graphId

returns.description: - A promise that returns the call response object (with the contents being a string representing a set of triples in turtle (ttl) format), or an Error if rejected.

name: updateTriples
description: Replace the contents of the specified graph with the passed triples encoded in the turtle (ttl) format

params.description: type of graph  |instance|schema|inference|
params.name: graphType

params.description: TerminusDB Graph ID
params.name: graphId

params.description: string encoding triples in turtle (ttl) format
params.name: turtle

params.description: Textual message describing the reason for the update
params.name: commitMsg

examples: client.updateTriples("schema", "alt", turtle_string, "dumping triples to graph alt")

returns.description: A promise that returns the call response object, or an Error if rejected.

name: insertTriples
description: Appends the passed turtle to the contents of a graph

params.description: type of graph  |instance|schema|inference|
params.name: graphType

params.description: TerminusDB Graph ID to update, main is the default value
params.name: graphId

params.description: is a valid set of triples in turtle format (OWL)
params.name: turtle

params.description: Textual message describing the reason for the update
params.name: commitMsg

returns.description: - A promise that returns the call response object, or an Error if rejected.

name: insertCSV
description: Inserts a csv from a specified path

params.description: is an array of csv file names with file path
params.name: csvPathList

params.description: Textual message describing the reason for the update
params.name: commitMsg

examples:
const filePath = ["C:/Users/User Name/Documents/example.csv"]
client.insertCSV(filePath, "inserting a CSV file", "instance", "main")

returns.description: - A promise that returns the call response object, or an Error if rejected.

name: updateCSV
description:
Updates the contents of the specified path with a csv, creating the appropriate
diff object as the commit.

params.description: Array csvs to upload
params.name: csvPathList

params.description: Textual message describing the reason for the update
params.name: commitMsg

params.description: type of graph  |instance|schema|inference|
params.name: graphType

params.description: TerminusDB Graph ID to update, main is the default value
params.name: graphId

returns.description: - A promise that returns the call response object, or an Error if rejected.

name: getCSV
description: Retrieves the contents of the specified graph as a CSV

params.description: Name of csv to dump from the specified database to extract
params.name: csvName

returns.description: An API success message

name: deleteCSV
description: Deletes CSV from your database

params.description: is an array of csv file names
params.name: csvName

params.description: Textual message describing the reason for the delete
params.name: commitMsg

returns.description: the rest api call results

name: message
description: Sends a message to the server

params.description: textual string
params.name: message

params.description: a server path to send the message to
params.name: pathname

returns.description: - A promise that returns the call response object, or an Error if rejected.

name: action
description: Sends an action to the server

params.description: structure of the action
params.name: actionName

params.description: a request body call
params.name: payload

returns.description: - A promise that returns the call response object, or an Error if rejected.

name: info
description: Gets TerminusDB Server Information

returns.description: - A promise that returns the call response object, or an Error if rejected.

name: query
description: Executes a WOQL query on the specified database and returns the results

params.description: an instance of the WOQLQuery class
params.name: woql

params.description: a message describing the reason for the change that will be written into the commit log (only relevant if the query contains an update)
params.name: commitMsg

returns.description: - A promise that returns the call response object, or an Error if rejected.

name: branch
description: Creates a new branch with a TerminusDB database, starting from the current context of the client (branch / ref)

params.description: local identifier of the new branch the ID of the new branch to be created
params.name: newBranchId

params.description: if the query contains any updates, it should include a textual message describing the reason for the update
params.name: sourceFree

returns.description: - A promise that returns the call response object, or an Error if rejected.

name: pull
description: Pull changes from a branch on a remote database to a branch on a local database

params.description: an object describing the source of the pull
params.name: remoteSourceRepo

returns.description: - A promise that returns the call response object, or an Error if rejected.

name: fetch
description: Fetch updates to a remote database to a remote repository with the local database

params.description: if of the remote to fetch (eg: 'origin')
params.name: remoteId

returns.description: - A promise that returns the call response object, or an Error if rejected.

name: push
description: Push changes from a branch on a local database to a branch on a remote database

params.description:
an object describing the target of the push
{remote: "origin", "remote_branch": "main", "author": "admin", "message": "message"}
params.name: remoteTargetRepo

returns.description: - A promise that returns the call response object, or an Error if rejected.

name: rebase
description: Merges the passed branch into the current one using the rebase operation

params.description: json describing the source branch to be used as a base
params.name: rebaseSource

returns.description: - A promise that returns the call response object, or an Error if rejected.

name: reset
description: Reset the current branch HEAD to the specified commit path

params.description: The commit path to set the current branch to
params.name: commitPath

returns.description: - A promise that returns the call response object, or an Error if rejected.

name: clonedb
description: Clones a remote repo and creates a local copy

params.description: object describing the source branch to be used as a base
params.name: cloneSource

params.description: id of the new cloned database on the local server
params.name: newDbId

params.description: id of the local organization that the new cloned database will be created in (in desktop mode this is always “admin”)
params.name: orgId

examples: client.clonedb({remote_url: "https://my.terminusdb.com/myorg/mydb", label "Cloned DB", comment: "Cloned from mydb"}, newid: "mydb")

returns.description: - A promise that returns the call response object, or an Error if rejected.

name: dispatch
description: Common request dispatch function

returns.description: - A promise that returns the call response object, or an Error if rejected.

name: generateCommitInfo
description: Generates the json structure for commit messages

params.description: textual string describing reason for the change
params.name: msg

params.description: optional author id string - if absent current user id will be used
params.name: author

name: prepareRevisionControlArgs
description: Adds an author string (from the user object returned by connect) to the commit message.

name: _load_db_prefixes
description:
Loads prefixes for each database connected to.
add the prefix at the connection database list

params.description: the user database list
params.name: dbs

returns.description: - the list of the databases

name: getClassFrame
description: Retrieves a class frame for the specified class

params.description: is the URL / ID of a document class that exists in the database schema
params.name: docType

name: updateDatabase
description: update the database details

params.description: an object that describe the database details
params.name: dbDoc

returns.description: - A promise that returns the call response object, or an Error if rejected.

name: organizations
description: Gets/Sets the list of organizations that the user belongs to (has roles for)

params.description: list of organization name
params.name: orgList

name: action_permitted
description: Check from the capabilities object if the action is permitted

params.description: the action name
params.name: action

params.description: the name of the resource (databaseName or organizationName)
params.name: resource

name: createUser
description: For creating an user

params.description: the userId
params.name: userId

params.description: the user's object description
params.name: userDoc

returns.description: - A promise that returns the call response object, or an Error if rejected.

name: getUser
description: Get the logged user details.

returns.description: - A promise that returns the call response object, or an Error if rejected.

name: updateUser
description: Update an user from the database.

params.description: User Object details
params.name: userDoc

returns.description: - A promise that returns the call response object, or an Error if rejected.

name: deleteUser
description: Delete an user from the database Only a user with DBA authority can delete a user.

returns.description: - A promise that returns the call response object, or an Error if rejected.

name: createOrganization
description: Create a new organization for the registered user

params.description: the organization id
params.name: orgId

params.description: An object that describe the organization's details
params.name: orgDoc

returns.description: - A promise that returns the call response object, or an Error if rejected.

name: getOrganization
description: Gets all the information about the given organization

params.description: the organization id
params.name: orgId

returns.description: - A promise that returns the call response object, or an Error if rejected.

name: updateOrganization
description:
only if you have the permission you can delete an organization
 Before you can delete the organization, you must first remove all accounts and databases
 from the organization

params.description: the organization id
params.name: orgId

params.description: the organization details description
params.name: orgDoc

returns.description: - A promise that returns the call response object, or an Error if rejected.

name: deleteOrganization
description:
only if you have the permission you can delete an organization
 Before you can delete the organization, you must first remove all accounts and databases
 from the organization

params.description: the organization id
params.name: orgId

returns.description: - A promise that returns the call response object, or an Error if rejected.

params.description: the user id
params.name: userId

params.description: the organization id
params.name: orgId

params.description: the dbId
params.name: dbId

returns.description: - A promise that returns the call response object, or an Error if rejected.

name: updateRoles
description: Change the user role for existing users in your organisation, including your own

returns.description: - A promise that returns the call response object, or an Error if rejected.
